content.question: Which of the following molecular equations could represent the reaction used to generate the titration curve?

choices.label: <math alttext="H 3 P O 4, aqueous, plus 3 L i O H, aqueous, react to produce 3 H 2 O, liquid, plus L i 3 P O 4, aqueous" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>PO</mtext> <mn>4</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>3</mtext> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>LiOH</mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>→</mo> <mtext>3</mtext> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>l</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mtext>Li</mtext> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>PO</mtext> <mn>4</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math>

<math alttext="H C l, aqueous, plus K O H, aqueous, react to produce H 2 O, liquid, plus K C l, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>KOH</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mtext>Cl</mtext><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="H F, aqueous, plus N a O H, aqueous, react to produce H 2 O, liquid, plus N a F, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mtext>HF</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>NaF</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

<math alttext="H N O 3, aqueous, plus N H 3, aqueous, react to produce N H 4 N O 3, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>HNO</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mtext>NH</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mtext>NH</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><msub><mtext>NO</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H F, aqueous, plus N a O H, aqueous, react to produce H 2 O, liquid, plus N a F, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mtext>HF</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>NaF</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
